[Shader Mixer Classes]

Detailed Description

Light that uses Shader Bricks to generate its shader.

void DzBrickLight::setGLShadow ( int  pass,
int  totalPasses,
int *  shadowMapSize = NULL 
) [virtual, slot]

Sets up the light for rendering to a shadow map in OpenGL

Parameters:
pass If the light is an area light and needs to be jittered during a multi-pass render, this is the index of the current pass.
totalPasses For area lights, this is the total number of jitter passes that will be
shadowMapSize A pointer to an integer that will be set to the size of the shadowmap that is generated by this light.

void DzBrickLight::setPointer ( const DzInFile *  file,
short  sectionID,
short  pointerID,
DzBase *  ptr 
) [virtual]

Called by the framework when reading a native file. Derived classes should override this method if they ever write out pointer values to the data file. This method will be called with the sectionID and pointerID that were given when writing the file out. The passed pointer may be shared so should not be deleted.

Parameters:
file The file being loaded
sectionID The ID of the file section being read
pointerID The ID of the pointer being read.
ptr The pointer being read.

Reimplemented from DzDefaultBrickUser.

const DzCamera *  camera 
) const [virtual, slot]

Sets the RenderMan parameters to render a shadow map for this light.

Parameters:
settings The render settings in use.
camera The camera that will be used for the final render of the view
